block.p: Monica Faye Azare, a daughter of Dorothy Davenport of Abbeville, La., and Calvin Azare of Lafayette, La., is to be married today to David Glen Davenport, a son of Mr. and Mrs. William G. Davenport of New York. The Rev. E. James Guidry, a Baptist minister, is to perform the ceremony in the chapel at Vermilionville, a Cajun and Creole living history village in Lafayette.

The bride, 33, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the senior director of government relations at Verizon Wireless Communications in Washington. Until March she was the legislative director and chief counsel in Washington for Representative Billy Tauzin, a Republican of Louisiana. She graduated from Louisiana State University and the Southern University Law Center. Her father is a car dealer at Southland Motors in Lafayette. Her mother is a water purification specialist for Abbeville.

She graduated from Louisiana State University and the Southern University Law Center. Her father is a car dealer at Southland Motors in Lafayette. Mr. Davenport, 34, is an investment officer at the Center for Community Development Enterprise, a division of Citigroup in New York. He is also a director of the Business Resource Investment Center, a community development organization in New York. He graduated from Wesleyan and received an M.B.A. degree from Columbia. His mother, Edith Davenport, retired as a social worker for the Board of Education. His father, who is retired, was the director of New York City programs at the Rockefeller Brothers Fund and the senior vice president of the Phipps Community Development Corporation, both in New York.
